ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Trust Runs a College by the Name Sri Shanmugha College of Engineering and Technology has been instituted in the academic year 2011  12, with the sublime aim of providing engineering education with a marked difference and commitment to excel in teaching, learning and research. The faculty here are well experienced, seasoned and prolific academicians. SSCET is located in an Extensive campus of about 100 acres on the state highway connecting Sankari with Tiruchengode. This institution is approved by All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) and affiliated to Anna University. Sri Shanmugha Educational Charitable Trust involved in providing quality education to the economically backward sections of rural Tamil Nadu. Sri Shanmugha Educational Charitable Trust was founded on 2010 has its prime objective of promoting higher and technical education, Mr.K.Shanmugham is the founder Chariman of the Trust. It has been established with a mission to redefine the system of Technical Education and disseminating the knowledge, skills in core and frontier disciplines through innovative and educative programmes, there by developing a new cadre of engineering professional with high level of competence, deep sense of social commitment and ethics. We have signed tie-ups and memorandum of understanding for imparting professional and vocational training programs with various Govt., Private and Public organizations. Shri Shanmugha Educational will prioritize these points through their International Training standards, and impart workforce/workplace training, on various industry specific subjects for active employment of the target community. The training is also imparted largely to cover the self-employment community.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: ACTIVITIES/ACHIEVEMENTS The role of SRC, Chennai is to provide academic and technical resource support to literacy and continuing education programmes. This is achieved in the state of Tamil Nadu, Pondicherry (UT) and Andaman & Nicobar Islands through the following strategies:  Training field level functionaries  Material development and production  Publication  Extension activities  Innovative Projects  Research Studies  Evaluations The major functions of the State Resource Centre, Chennai are:  Development of teaching-learning and training materials for literacy and Continuing Education programmes  Training literacy and Continuing Education functionaries  Training field level functionaries at district, block and taluk levels  Undertaking initiatives in training CE personnel, consultants and resource persons.  Multimedia development for literacy and Continuing Education  Running of field level programmes  Monitoring of literacy and Continuing Education Projects  Undertaking projects and research in the areas of literacy and continuing education  Reaching the grass root level beneficiaries through linkage/convergence with various developmental departments of state Govt.  Training the functionaries of SHGs  Extending vocational education courses through reputed organisations  Strengthening equivalency programme both internally and through linkages with open schools/open universities  Understanding innovative projects/studies  To assist State Literacy Mission Authorities in monitoring and evaluating the impact and literacy & CE programmes in the state. ACHIEVEMENTS  Published so far more than 500 materials/books in the area of continuing education  Developed more than 30 literacy primers  Prepared target-specific primers like primers for visually impaired developed  Planned and designed training manuals on more than 30 topics including those on leadership, women empowerment, Self Help Groups and their formation, sustainability, hygiene, adolescent issues etc.  Monthly organ Yetram published since 1978  Initiatives in integrating the use of computer in continuing education  Periodical monitoring of CE centres in coordination with Dept. of Non-formal and Adult Education, Govt. of Tamil Nadu

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Under this Trust we have established St Joseph School at Manavalakurichy in 2012 for the upliftment of Rural Backward and under privileged Children. Now the total strength is around 1800. The school is located in a sprawling area of 6 acres. A Boys Home has been established in 2007 for the benefit of Orphaned, Semi Orphaned Boys to provide better education and shelter. We have Ocean a self help group organised exclusively for women. It enhances women empowerment and socio economic freedom.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: St Joseph Children Home established in the year 2005-06 to cater to the needs of the orphans, semi orphans, marginalised, deprived, downtrodden and rural children. The main objective of the Children Home is to provide better education, shelter and food to the above mentioned category of children. In the year 2014-15 we had 46 children. We were providing uniforms, other dresses, notebooks and items of daily needs. We had qualified staff to look after their academic and non academic activities.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Rotary Club of Malta and Mathew Schneider and others
sourceOfFunds.purpose: St Joseph Children Home was established in the year 2005-06 and St Joseph School was established in the year 2012-13 to cater to the needs of the orphans, semi orphans, marginalised, deprived, downtrodden and rural children. The main objective of both the Children Home and School is to provide better education to the above mentioned category of children. In 2015-16 we had 50 children in the Home and we had around 950 children in the School. We had staff to look after their academic activities.
